name: Butanobu.GitHub.io
tagline: A page where I write things that people read
body: ## Welcome to my page I'm going to keep this simple because I want to get info out to you, without taking too much time about it. Proper engineering style. It's all just my findings. Corrections and improvements are more than welcome. Flames etc can be emailed to me - just put the word "tarpit" in the subject line to get my full attention. Here we go. ## What's in here? * Some stuff about [Linux](#linux) * Some stuff about [Docker](#docker) ## Linux * [Setting up an Epson printer in Ubuntu](#epson) ### Epson Printer Epson make really good printers (IMO) but they know very little about computers, websites or technical documents by the look of it. It took me a while to get my Epson printer set up in Ubuntu, and I couldn't find everything in one place, so I've summarised the steps here. * Add `deb http://download.ebz.epson.net/dsc/op/stable/debian/ lsb3.2 main` to sources.list or your own `.list` file in `/etc/apt/sources.list.d/` * Run `sudo apt-get update` * Grab the ID of the key that is missing for their repo. * Run `sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys ` * Run `sudo apt-get update` again. * Find your printer at [Open Printing](https://www.openprinting.org/printers) and get the name of the driver * `sudo apt-cache search` for elements of the driver name, then `sudo apt-get install` it. * Finally, go through the regular `Add Printer` dialogue in Ubuntu to find and install your printer in the usual way. ## Docker まだです。
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
